title.narrative: Increasing access to inclusive quality education and lifelong learning for children and young adults with deafblindness in Bangladesh

description.narrative: 450 children/young adults with deafblindness will access quality inclusive education and vocational skills, leading to improved quality of life for themselves, 1,800 family members and their communities, through: 1) Improved infrastructure for inclusion of people with deafblindness through strengthened CSOs; 2) children/young adults with deafblindness and their families receiving community-based support; 3) school inclusion; and 4) evidence and training on inclusive education for the Government.

activity-date.narrative: The project duration is 36 months (1st July 2018-30th June 2021 including NCE)
The project duration is 36 months (1st July 2018-30th June 2021 including NCE)

mailing-address.narrative: Sense International, 101 Pentonville Road, London, N1 9LG

recipient-country.narrative: Transfers from Sense International to CDD as lead partner in Bangladesh
Transfers from Sense International to Sense International India as technical partner

sector.narrative: 360 children with deafblindness benefitting from community-based support and/or inclusion in school education.
90 young adults benefitting from community-based livelihood support.
